verses.verse: That which<WH834> came<WH1961> as the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068> to Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> concerning<WH413> the Philistines,<WH6430> before<WH2962> Pharaoh<WH6547> conquered<WH5221> Gaza.<WH5804>

Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord:<WH3068> "Behold,<WH2009> waters<WH4325> are going to rise<WH5927> from the north<WH6828> And become<WH1961> an overflowing<WH7857> torrent,<WH5158> And overflow<WH7857> the land<WH776> and all<WH4393> its fulness,<WH4393> The city<WH5892> and those who live<WH3427> in it; And the men<WH120> will cry<WH2199> out, And every<WH3605> inhabitant<WH3427> of the land<WH776> will wail.<WH3213>

"Because<WH4480> of the noise<WH6963> of the galloping<WH8161> hoofs<WH6541> of his stallions,<WH47> The tumult<WH7494> of his chariots,<WH7393> [and] the rumbling<WH1995> of his wheels,<WH1534> The fathers have not turned<WH1> back<WH6437> for [their] children,<WH6437> Because<WH1121> of the limpness<WH4480> of [their] hands,<WH7510>

On account<WH5921> of the day<WH3117> that is coming<WH935> To destroy<WH7703> all<WH3605> the Philistines,<WH6430> To cut<WH3772> off<WH3772> from Tyre<WH6865> and Sidon<WH6721> Every<WH3605> ally<WH5826> that is left;<WH8300> For the Lord<WH3068> is going to destroy<WH7703> the Philistines,<WH6430> The remnant<WH7611> of the coastland<WH339> of Caphtor.<WH3731>
"Baldness<WH7144> has come<WH935> upon Gaza;<WH5804> Ashkelon<WH831> has been ruined.<WH1820> O remnant<WH7611> of their valley,<WH6010> How<WH4970> long<WH5704> will you gash<WH1413> yourself?
"Ah, sword<WH2719> of the Lord,<WH3068> How<WH575> long<WH5704> will you not be quiet<WH8252>? Withdraw<WH622> into your sheath;<WH8593> Be at rest<WH7280> and stay<WH1826> still.<WH1826>

"How<WH349> can it be quiet,<WH8252> When the Lord<WH3068> has given<WH6680> it an order<WH6680>? Against<WH413> Ashkelon<WH831> and against<WH413> the seacoast<WH3220> <WH2348> â€“ There<WH8033> He has assigned<WH3259> it."
